stimulusHtml: A conductive loop is attached to a cart that moves with a constant velocity vi through a region of constant magnetic field B directed out of the page, as shown. What is the direction of the current in the loop as the cart exits the field, and why?
choicesHtml: Clockwise, because the flux through the loop is decreasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field out of the page.
Clockwise, because the flux through the loop is increasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field into the page.
Counterclockwise, because the flux through the loop is decreasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field out of the page.
Counterclockwise, because the flux through the loop is increasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field into the page.
